item.title: Finally free? Detention, the European Arrest Warrant, and Julian Assange
item.description: Steve Peers The recent Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) decision in the Lanigan case, which deals with prolonged pre-trial detention and the European Arrest Warrant (EAW), is especially noteworthy given the UN’s recent statement regarding Julian Assange’s “arbitrary detention.” Assange, who is also facing an EAW, presents a unique situation. What can we learn from each of these cases about the intersection of detention length and the EAW?
